Detailed Description

Defines a templated dual-quaternion type and several dual-quaternion operations.

<glm/gtx/dual_quaternion.hpp> need to be included to use these functionalities.

Typedef Documentation

typedef highp_ddualquat glm::ddualquat

GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER detail::tdualquat< T, P > glm::dualquat_cast ( detail::tmat3x4< T, P > const &  x  )  [inline]

Converts a 3 * 4 matrix (augmented matrix rotation + translation) to a quaternion.

References glm::sqrt().

00372         {
00373                 detail::tquat<T, P> real;
00374                 
00375                 T const trace = x[0].x + x[1].y + x[2].z;
00376                 if(trace > T(0))
00377                 {
00378                         T const r = sqrt(T(1) + trace);
00379                         T const invr = static_cast<T>(0.5) / r;
00380                         real.w = static_cast<T>(0.5) * r;
00381                         real.x = (x[2].y - x[1].z) * invr;
00382                         real.y = (x[0].z - x[2].x) * invr;
00383                         real.z = (x[1].x - x[0].y) * invr;
00384                 }
00385                 else if(x[0].x > x[1].y && x[0].x > x[2].z)
00386                 {
00387                         T const r = sqrt(T(1) + x[0].x - x[1].y - x[2].z);
00388                         T const invr = static_cast<T>(0.5) / r;
00389                         real.x = static_cast<T>(0.5)*r;
00390                         real.y = (x[1].x + x[0].y) * invr;
00391                         real.z = (x[0].z + x[2].x) * invr;
00392                         real.w = (x[2].y - x[1].z) * invr;
00393                 }
00394                 else if(x[1].y > x[2].z)
00395                 {
00396                         T const r = sqrt(T(1) + x[1].y - x[0].x - x[2].z);
00397                         T const invr = static_cast<T>(0.5) / r;
00398                         real.x = (x[1].x + x[0].y) * invr;
00399                         real.y = static_cast<T>(0.5) * r;
00400                         real.z = (x[2].y + x[1].z) * invr;
00401                         real.w = (x[0].z - x[2].x) * invr;
00402                 }
00403                 else
00404                 {
00405                         T const r = sqrt(T(1) + x[2].z - x[0].x - x[1].y);
00406                         T const invr = static_cast<T>(0.5) / r;
00407                         real.x = (x[0].z + x[2].x) * invr;
00408                         real.y = (x[2].y + x[1].z) * invr;
00409                         real.z = static_cast<T>(0.5) * r;
00410                         real.w = (x[1].x - x[0].y) * invr;
00411                 }
00412                 
00413                 detail::tquat<T, P> dual;
00414                 dual.x =  T(0.5) * ( x[0].w * real.w + x[1].w * real.z - x[2].w * real.y);
00415                 dual.y =  T(0.5) * (-x[0].w * real.z + x[1].w * real.w + x[2].w * real.x);
00416                 dual.z =  T(0.5) * ( x[0].w * real.y - x[1].w * real.x + x[2].w * real.w);
00417                 dual.w = -T(0.5) * ( x[0].w * real.x + x[1].w * real.y + x[2].w * real.z);
00418                 return detail::tdualquat<T, P>(real, dual);
00419         }

Returns the linear interpolation of two dual quaternion.

Definition at line 282 of file dual_quaternion.inl.

References glm::dot(), and glm::one().

00287         {
00288                 // Dual Quaternion Linear blend aka DLB:
00289                 // Lerp is only defined in [0, 1]
00290                 assert(a >= static_cast<T>(0));
00291                 assert(a <= static_cast<T>(1));
00292                 T const k = dot(x.real,y.real) < static_cast<T>(0) ? -a : a;
00293                 T const one(1);
00294                 return detail::tdualquat<T, P>(x * (one - a) + y * k);
00295         }
